title: FS: 1887 N284 Buchner Gold Coin Old Hoss Radbourn Just Back From SGC SOLD
author: Moonlight Graham

posts.post_title: FS: 1887 N284 Buchner Gold Coin Old Hoss Radbourn Just Back From SGC SOLD
posts.post_content:
It graded an Authentic, but I do not believe the card is trimmed. Now of course I'm not a professional grader, but I just can't find the normal look of trimming. But like I said, what do I know? Anyhoo, the card is beautiful!! And this is a tough HOF'er! The price is SOLD delivered PayPal F&F please. Thank you for checking out my sale.

Joe K

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=506306&d=1646706759[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=506307&d=1646706769[/IMG]

Did SGC say it was trimmed? Probably A because of the writing on the back if not specified on your account 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

No they didn't but I assumed that. The writing on the back typically means the card will receive a grade no higher than 1.5.

Joe

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=506358&d=1646749976[/IMG]
Here is an example of one of my cards that came back A. The label is identical to yours. In my orders it will say Evidence of Trimming if the graders thought it was trimmed. It won’t specify this on the label. Hope this helps! 

David 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

The A on the 61 mantle is because it’s a blank back which they specified on label. 
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=506359&d=1646750544[/IMG]

The A on the dairy Lea mantle is due to trimming.
